subject: Mental Health
title: Medication-Assisted Treatment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Medication-Assisted Treatment.

hook.text: Methadone has saved more opioid-addicted lives than any other single intervention.

buildup.text: MAT uses medications to stabilize brain chemistry while the person rebuilds their life.

discovery.text: Naltrexone blocks opioid receptors; buprenorphine partially activates them to prevent craving.

twist.text: Stigma against MAT means many treatment programs refuse to use these proven drugs.

climax.text: MAT reduces overdose deaths by over 50 percent compared to abstinence-only programs.

punchline.text: Using medicine for a brain disease shouldn't be controversial.

quiz.question: How much does MAT reduce overdose deaths compared to abstinence-only?
